text: so this is a commercial system available
from sensors Inc and this was a
collaborative development project
between Ford and sensors Ford started
many years ago doing tunnel studies of
exhaust emissions and out of that came a
portable analyzer called the preview
system which was a prototype system and
we approached sensors after the
development of the preview and asked
them if they could commercialize the
system so we transferred technology and
intellectual property to sensors and
they came up with the SEM tackle
es which is this is a diesel and out
analyzer that can go onboard heavy-duty
trucks or off-road vehicles and the EPA
is using it to measure not to exceed
threshold emissions as part of their
requirements for heavy-duty diesel
vehicles okay so the the septic D ash
uses a non-dispersive infrared
technology it has also a UV measurement
for a no and no2 not the oxides of
nitrogen and it also has onboard a
portable flame ionization detector for
hydrocarbons so it measures hydrocarbons
carbon monoxide carbon dioxide and the
oxides of nitrogen on board at a rate of
one Hertz
